text:
Hvidgylden uklar skum lidt hvid 
Pære stald jord 
Bitter moderat sød lidt sur lidt 
Flad tør 
@gbbf 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught @ Gallows Bird, Espoo, Real Ale Festival 2008. Very clear, loke Sprite. Full apple/perry aroma, gooseberry. Strong. Taste very good, not too sweety, aaah.... some mint in the finish.

Cask gravity at the Tewkesbury Winter Ale Festival, 02/02/2008. A pear flavour with  some hints of apple. Fairly citric and sour. Quite dry, despite the medium label. Enjoyable, but would be more drinkable with less sourness.

Draught (Gallows Bird, Espoo, Real Ale Festival 2008)
Insipid colour. Sharp crisp estery aroma. Quite cidery. Taste is beautiful - refreshing fruity pears and apples. Toffee in there too, and a slight hint of bacon. Very easy drinking. No astringency or acidity, or even any sense of alcohol. Excellent perry. Not a beer though.

Comments: Very sharp for a perry, highly aromatic, syrupy nose with jammy undertones. Beyond the usual juiciness despite being quite sweet. One of my favourite perries and probably my favourite sweetish one.
From the barrel as Hartlands Farmhouse Perry. Big aroma of ripe pears. Sweet mature pear flavour with quite some acidity to create a very nice balance.
clowdy orange  as i expected, with a nice balanced tart but fruityness to it. one of best perrys ive had
From the barrel - Oxford BF.  A hazy green coloured perry with an aroma of sharp pears.  The taste is on the sweet side of medium with plenty of pear flesh.  A well produced nicely drinkable perry.
Direct from polypin at The Tite Inn, Chadlington, Oxon. Pale apricot colour, no head. Particularly sweet perry with a strong peardrop acidic note. Ok.
[At GBBF 2005] An unclear orange perry ofcourse with no head. The aroma is strong of pears, combined with some notes of alcohol. The flavor is nicely sweet with notes of over ripe pears. Nice.
